hero.label: About Us
hero.h1: We build the intelligence that <highlight>moves the physical world.</highlight>
hero.text: We are not just devs. We are field engineers. We transform the chaos of warehouses and cities into certain, stable and ready-for-decision data.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.text: We transform the chaos of real operations into clean, reliable and actionable data, returning control to those who manage complex processes.

acts.label: The Problem
acts.title: Traditional tracking lies.
acts.text: In 2021 we noticed a pattern: office demos were perfect. But in steelworks, among containers or in railway depots, the signal disappeared. Clients bought promises and ended up with 'random dots' on the map.

acts.label: The Turning Point
acts.title: Data, not just signals.
acts.text: We realized that hardware alone was not enough. An intelligence layer capable of filtering industrial noise was needed. We stopped looking for the perfect sensor and built the algorithm that corrects it.

acts.label: Today
acts.title: Operating System for the Field.
acts.text: Today Ulisses is not a tracker. It is the infrastructure of truth for companies that move the real world. From logistics to smart city.

items.title: Field First
items.text: Code is written in the office, but truth is found in the mud. We don't trust it until we see it working between metal and concrete.

items.title: Radical Truth
items.text: We sell certain data. If a datum is uncertain, we declare it. We never mask the error.

items.title: Ship & Iterate
items.text: Perfection is the enemy of operations. We deliver value immediately, then refine.

engineRoom.title: How we work
engineRoom.text: We are a product team, not a project-based software house. Every line of code enters a shared system that improves for all clients every week.

stories.title: Typical Scenarios & Stories
stories.text: Operational resolutions based on real challenges in warehousing, workshops, and Smart City.

items.title: Forklifts are there... but every shift starts from zero
items.text: In a busy warehouse, forklifts and rolls are never where they should be. Ulisses introduces visibility for shifts and departments.

fullContent.scenario: In a warehouse with intense shifts and flows, forklifts, rolls, and equipment are never 'where they should be'. They move between aisles, bays, picking and staging areas. On paper they are present, but in operational reality they become invisible. The team doesn't just lose minutes: it loses process continuity.
fullContent.challenge: The problem isn't simply 'finding an object'. It's the domino effect: delays, micro-stoppages, friction between departments, allocation errors, and worsening KPIs without a clear cause.
fullContent.resolution: Ulisses introduces visibility designed for daily use: immediate asset search (ID/name/category), status and availability by area (e.g., 'in use', 'available', 'stopped', 'out of area'), movement/event history. The platform delivers operational dashboards with simple filtering.
fullContent.productionReady: It starts with a site survey to map areas, then commissioning to validate field experience. A minimal set of rules is defined (entry/exit/dwell) and the state model is aligned to how Operations actually works.
fullContent.result: Less wasted time, reduced micro-stoppages, increased asset utilization, and a reliable data foundation for continuous improvement.
fullContent.introCTA: Want to measure the 'hidden time' spent searching for assets?

items.title: Geofencing & Anomalies: When process has boundaries
items.text: Without automatic rules, problems are noticed too late. Ulisses enables geofencing and time thresholds for proactive control.

fullContent.scenario: In logistics, some areas aren't just physical zones: they are process boundaries. Exits, gates, restricted areas, HSE zones, temporary buffers. Without operational control, exceptions become habits.
fullContent.challenge: Without automatic rules, problems are noticed too late: an asset leaves and disappears, a pallet stays in a critical area, equipment enters where it shouldn't. The cost is safety, compliance, and control.
fullContent.resolution: Ulisses enables simple but robust operational rules: geofences for sensitive areas, time thresholds (dwell time, max time), targeted alerts with priority. The goal is to create a system that supports decisions.
fullContent.productionReady: Governance is critical: defining useful rules with Operations/HSE, setting escalation and ownership. Observability prevents false alarms.
fullContent.result: Reduced dispersion and non-compliance, greater safety, stable processes, and useful traceability for audits.
fullContent.introCTA: Want to define rules and alerts without creating noise?

items.title: Tough Environments: Data quality makes the difference
items.text: Metal structures, interference, multipath. Ulisses works with an industrial approach for stable data.

fullContent.scenario: Metal structures, interference, multipath: the real context where many solutions work 'intermittently'. When data is unstable, operators stop trusting it.
fullContent.challenge: It's not enough to 'detect'. You need data that withstands daily use: repeatable, monitorable, with clear anomaly management.
fullContent.resolution: Ulisses works with an industrial approach: design, field validation, and a platform that measures system health. Technology becomes a reliable foundation for processes.
fullContent.productionReady: Design and field validation. Health observability guarantees continuity.
fullContent.result: Fewer false events, greater continuity, real adoption by teams.
fullContent.introCTA: Want to learn how we manage tough environments?

items.title: Train position & Digital Twin: Milan Fiorenza PoC
items.text: For Trenord, we explored sub-meter positioning in depots to optimize maintenance flows.

fullContent.scenario: In a large railway depot, maintenance is a complex machine of continuous movements, physical constraints, and precise sequences. For Trenord, knowing train positions precisely is a prerequisite for efficiency.
fullContent.challenge: The challenge wasn't just abstract tracking, but obtaining reliable, precise data usable in real processes. Traditional technologies were ineffective indoors or too invasive.
fullContent.resolution: Ulisses realized an operational PoC: installation on 50 trains, coverage of 12 tracks at Milan Fiorenza, and continuous tracking via Digital Twin.
fullContent.productionReady: Sub-meter precision, self-powered devices, native API integration, and scalability ready for the entire site.
fullContent.result: Optimized maintenance flows, better planning, and creation of a centralized data layer for predictive models.
fullContent.introCTA: Want to replicate a similar Proof of Concept?

items.title: Maintenance stops when equipment is missing
items.text: If a critical tool is unavailable, the plan breaks. Ulisses makes tools and assets trackable with clear states.

fullContent.scenario: In a workshop or depot, knowing where materials and tools are is crucial. Delays are often due to searching for equipment.
fullContent.challenge: Disconnected silos between the workshop and the office lead to inefficiencies.
fullContent.resolution: Ulisses maps the workshop and tracks assets in real-time, providing operational truth.
fullContent.productionReady: Seamless integration into existing workshop processes.
fullContent.result: Reduced search times, fewer delays, greater control over operational availability.
fullContent.introCTA: Want to define a pilot in your workshop?

items.title: From event to action: Connecting field to CMMS
items.text: Native API integration to connect the field to maintenance and ticketing workflows.

fullContent.scenario: Many organizations have a CMMS. But often the 'field' is disconnected: events and anomalies are discovered late and reported without context.
fullContent.challenge: If data remains isolated, complexity increases. Value comes when the event is reliable, contextualized, and integrated.
fullContent.resolution: Ulisses produces structured events (position, state, anomalies) and makes them integrable via API into workflows like ticketing and dispatch.
fullContent.productionReady: Process mapping, commissioning data quality, and SLA governance. Integration becomes clean because the event is designed for consumption.
fullContent.result: Faster interventions, reduced downtime, greater predictability.
fullContent.introCTA: Want to see an event-to-ticket workflow example?

items.title: Critical materials: control, permissions, history
items.text: Some components can't 'roam free'. Simple but rigorous event traceability.

fullContent.scenario: Some components cannot roam free. Area control and movement traceability are needed.
fullContent.challenge: The problem isn't just loss. It's the lack of evidence: who moved what, when, and where.
fullContent.resolution: Ulisses enables simple event traceability: entry/exit, dwell time, anomalous movements.
fullContent.productionReady: Configuration of sensitive areas and compliance reporting.
fullContent.result: Reduced dispersion and greater auditability without burdening operators.

items.title: Reliable Occupancy: The city stops guessing
items.text: Real occupancy data for planning, enforcement, and reporting.

fullContent.scenario: A city needs to govern parking with concrete goals. Without reliable data, management remains reactive.
fullContent.challenge: The point isn't a 'pretty map'. It's reliable data. If occupancy isn't credible, trust collapses. Outdoor data quality is the challenge.
fullContent.resolution: Ulisses enables occupancy per stall/zone, with history and trends. Dashboards show operational status, anomalies, and health indicators.
fullContent.productionReady: Correct zoning, commissioning, and continuous quality monitoring.
fullContent.result: Data-driven decisions, solid reports, better service.

items.title: Duration, overstay & data quality: targeted enforcement with controlled OPEX
items.text: Move from visual control to prioritized control, with private network and controllable OPEX.

fullContent.scenario: Field operators have limited time. Random checks lose effectiveness. When checks are driven by data (duration, overstay, priority), management becomes more efficient and measurable.
fullContent.challenge: The quality leap is to move from 'visual check' to 'prioritized check' without creating noise. At scale, sustainability and recurring costs come into play: you need a predictable rollout with governance.
fullContent.resolution: Ulisses produces operational events: parking duration, overstay, stall profiles and priority. The dashboard shows what needs attention now. For scaling projects, architecture includes options for managing performance and costs (including private network).
fullContent.productionReady: Shared rules, control workflows, reports, and above all observability. Treat the system as a service: KPIs, SLAs, and targeted maintenance.
fullContent.result: More effective enforcement, better resource use, data quality maintained over time, more predictable rollout.
fullContent.introCTA: Want to set up a phased rollout with clear KPIs and SLAs?

items.title: Medical devices are there... but when needed they can't be found
items.text: Defibrillators, infusion pumps, ventilators. Available on paper, invisible in practice.

fullContent.scenario: In a hospital, defibrillators, infusion pumps, ventilators, and stretchers constantly move between departments, warehouses, and intervention areas. On paper they are available. In practice they become invisible.
fullContent.challenge: The problem is not simply 'finding a device'. It is the domino effect: clinical delays, friction between departments, inefficient use of equipment, duplicated costs. When trying to introduce unreliable tracking tools, the real critical issue emerges: if the data is not stable and accurate, staff stops using it. In a healthcare context, error is not an option.
fullContent.resolution: Ulisses introduces visibility designed for critical environments: real-time localization on a digital map, immediate search by ID, category or department, asset status by area ('in use', 'available', 'in maintenance'), movement history for audits and operational analysis.
fullContent.productionReady: It starts with a site survey to map departments, sensitive areas, and real flows. Commissioning follows to validate accuracy and coverage. Together we define operational rules aligned with how staff actually works.
fullContent.result: Reduction in search times, higher utilization of existing assets, fewer redundant purchases, and a reliable database for planning, maintenance, and continuous improvement.
fullContent.introCTA: Do you want to measure how much time is lost every day looking for critical assets?

items.title: The city is connected. But is it governed by a true urban Digital Twin?
items.text: ZTLs, environmental gates, reserved lanes: isolated systems producing non-integrated data.

fullContent.scenario: ZTLs, environmental gates, reserved lanes, priority areas: systems are often isolated and produce non-integrated data. Without an urban Digital Twin unifying access, flows, and environmental compliance, administration reacts to events rather than governing the system. The problem is not controlling a gate: it is transforming real flows into strategic decisions.
fullContent.challenge: The problem is not just monitoring access or detecting a violation. It is building a coherent digital representation of urban flows. Administrations must guarantee compliance with environmental regulations, reduce the impact of the most polluting vehicles, monitor the effectiveness of mobility policies, and have defensible and structured data. Without an integrated digital model, the data remains isolated and does not become a governance tool.
fullContent.resolution: The Ulisses platform enables the construction of an urban Digital Twin, a dynamic digital replica of city mobility. Through distributed sensors and real-time analysis, the system allows to monitor entries and exits, identify non-compliant vehicles, analyze flows by time slot/zone, evaluate the occupancy of reserved areas, generate structured reports to support political decisions. The result is an integrated vision that surpasses the logic of punctual control and enables systemic management.
fullContent.productionReady: It starts with the mapping of strategic city points and areas subject to regulation. Flow models, access rules, and monitoring KPIs are defined. The platform is configured to align with the needs of the administration. The system is modular and scalable, ready to be extended.
fullContent.result: Reduction of non-compliant violations, greater effectiveness of ZTLs, structured data for institutional reporting, and a solid information base for sustainable mobility policies.
fullContent.introCTA: What if the city could be governed through its digital twin?

items.title: PA fleet management: real visibility or just final reports?
items.text: Local Police vehicles, technical vehicles, street maintenance: management is often fragmented.

fullContent.scenario: Local Police vehicles, technical vehicles, street maintenance, environmental services, social transport: fleet management in Public Administration is often fragmented between isolated GPS and non-integrated systems. Without a real-time updated urban Digital Twin, visibility on vehicles is partial, planning is reactive, and operational costs grow without real oversight.
fullContent.challenge: Fleet management in the PA is not just knowing 'where a vehicle is'. It is guaranteeing real availability of vehicles, correct assignment by service, respect of operational areas, traceability of interventions. Without an integrated system: manual steps multiply, time is lost searching, overlaps or underutilization occur, it becomes difficult to report. The problem is not the fleet. It is the absence of an operational Digital Twin connecting vehicles, territory, and missions.
fullContent.resolution: Ulisses enables better management of the public fleet, integrating it with the territory. The platform allows: real-time localization of vehicles on an urban map, operational status of the vehicle, monitoring permanence in areas, movement and mission history, dashboard for managers. The system can be integrated via API with management software in use.
fullContent.productionReady: It starts with the census of municipal vehicles and the definition of areas of competence. Each vehicle is equipped with a discreet tracking device. The platform is configured on specific needs: shifts, routes, KPIs, alerts. Integration closes the loop between planning and execution.
fullContent.result: Greater utilization of existing vehicles, reduction of downtime, objective control of missions, and a structured database for continuous optimization of the public fleet.
fullContent.introCTA: Do you want real-time visibility on your public fleet?

items.title: With Ministry of Tourism, we resolve marina management
items.text: Collaborating with the Ministry of Tourism to digitize Italian marinas.

fullContent.scenario: In a marina, daily management involves arrivals, departures, occupancy, and access. Reliable vision is a prerequisite for efficiency.
fullContent.challenge: In complex contexts like Italian ports, inefficiencies translate to lost time and poor resource use.
fullContent.resolution: Ulisses initiated a digitalization project: data collection, reservation management, localization sensors, real-time occupancy.
fullContent.productionReady: Real-time occupancy status without invasive infrastructure, ready for integration.
fullContent.result: Improved operational efficiency, safety, and reception quality.

items.title: Containers in the yard... but the real position is never certain
items.text: In high-density terminals, goods and containers move continuously. Without stable localization, operational downtime grows.

fullContent.scenario: In high-density port terminals, goods and containers move between ship, yard, and transport vehicles. Stacked, shielded by metal, distributed over thousands of square meters. Without stable and reliable localization, search times increase, loading/unloading operations slow down, and operational downtime grows.
fullContent.challenge: In the port sector, the problem is not simply 'finding a container'. It is the loss of operational control when the yard grows in size, density, and complexity. Containers stacked up to multiple levels, extensive operational areas. When localization is not reliable, operations slow down, search times and ship-shore flow micro-downtimes increase. And in environments with high metal density, the data must be stable and coherent.
fullContent.resolution: Ulisses introduces visibility designed for highly complex physical environments. The system allows: real-time localization on a digital map, identification of presence in an area, dynamic container-load unit association, monitoring of operations. The platform returns filterable operational dashboards. Accuracy is calibrated: centimetric or by macro-area based on the objective.
fullContent.productionReady: We start from a technical site survey: we analyze metal density and shielding, we study paths to optimize the placement of anchors and gateways. Field commissioning follows. Together, we define operational rules aligned to real terminal processes. The system can be integrated via API with the management system in use.
fullContent.result: Reduction of container search times, fluidity in ship-shore operations, decrease in downtime and handling errors, database for efficiency analysis.
fullContent.introCTA: Want to optimize your port terminal's operations?

items.q: Can we integrate with existing systems?
items.a: Yes, Ulisses exposes robust APIs and normalized data models for WMS, CMMS, ERP and other platforms.

items.q: Is it necessary to use the Ulisses platform?
items.a: No, the platform is optional. You can consume data directly via API in your systems.
Ulisses manages both with optimized technologies for each context, ensuring continuity between areas.

items.q: How do you guarantee data quality over time?
items.a: Through network and device health monitoring, proactive alerts and quality reports.
A typical pilot takes 4 to 8 weeks, depending on complexity and integration requirements.

trenord.title: With <highlight>Trenord</highlight>, bringing train localization in depots from a problem to operational data

narrative.p1: In a large railway depot, maintenance is a complex machine made up of continuous movements, physical constraints, and precise sequences.
narrative.p2: For Trenord, the first regional railway company in Italy, knowing with precision the position of convoys in the depot is a prerequisite for ensuring efficiency, service reliability, and operational continuity.
narrative.p3: In the Milano Fiorenza depot, the largest in Europe, even small inefficiencies in train localization translate into delays, unnecessary movements, and greater complexity in maintenance planning.

challenge.title: The Shared Challenge
challenge.text: It wasn't enough to "know where the trains are" in the abstract. The real challenge was to obtain reliable, precise, and usable data in real processes. Traditional technologies were ineffective in complex indoor environments or too invasive for large-scale adoption.

resolution.title: Operational Resolution
resolution.text1: In collaboration with Trenord, Ulisses carried out an operational Proof of Concept for the localization of convoys in the depot. The PoC included the installation of Ulisses transponders on 50 convoys and full coverage of 12 tracks, ensuring continuous tracking of movements and visualization via Digital Twin.
resolution.text2: The solution allowed Trenord to accurately monitor train movement via a dedicated platform, without invasive infrastructure interventions.

footer.title: Production Ready
footer.text: The project was developed together with the IT, Innovation, and Maintenance functions of Trenord. The potential that emerged led to evaluating the extension to the entire Milano Fiorenza site.

ministero.title: With the <highlight>Ministry of Tourism</highlight>, bringing marina management from a problem to operational data

narrative.p1: In a marina, daily management consists of arrivals and departures, berth occupancy, access, service vehicles, and attendance to be monitored in real time.
narrative.p2: For marina managers and the Ministry of Tourism, having a reliable view of what happens in the port is a prerequisite for improving operational efficiency, safety, and reception quality.
narrative.p3: In complex contexts like Italian marinas, even small inefficiencies in managing occupancy and attendance translate into lost time, inefficient resource use, and difficulties in ensuring control and traceability.

challenge.title: The Shared Challenge
challenge.text: It wasn't enough to just census the berths. The real challenge was to monitor effective occupancy in real time and track the movements of boats and service vehicles, obtaining precise data to support strategic and operational decisions, both locally and nationally.

resolution.title: Operational Resolution
resolution.text1: Within the collaboration with the Ministry of Tourism, Ulisses initiated a digitalization project based on operational localization. The project included the installation of a network of sensors for monitoring berth occupancy and tracking service vehicles.
resolution.text2: The solution allowed for collecting and analyzing data on: real-time occupancy, attendance history, access flows, and resource usage, all visualized on a unified dashboard for data-driven management.

footer.title: Production Ready
footer.text: The solution allows marina managers to know the occupancy status of the port in real time, without invasive infrastructure interventions and with data ready for integration into existing systems.
